item.title: Google Cancels Town Hall After Employee's Controversial Diversity Memo
item.description: August 10, 2017 - The meeting had been called to discuss fallout from the memo written by a senior software engineer who complained that "biological causes" explained why women were underrepresented at the tech giant.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 10, 2017 - The meeting had been called to discuss fallout from the memo written by a senior software engineer who complained that "biological causes" explained why women were underrepresented at the tech giant. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/10/542724804/google-cancels-town-hall-after-employees-controversial-diversity-memo

item.title: Colleges Have Increased Women Computer Science Majors: What Can Google Learn?
item.description: August 10, 2017 - About half of Harvey Mudd College computer science graduates are women, up sharply in the past decade. It and other schools found success by adjusting their curriculums and making other changes.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 10, 2017 - About half of Harvey Mudd College computer science graduates are women, up sharply in the past decade. It and other schools found success by adjusting their curriculums and making other changes. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/08/10/542638758/colleges-have-increased-women-computer-science-majors-what-can-google-learn

item.title: Russian Cyberattack Targeted Elections Vendor Tied To Voting Day Disruptions
item.description: August 10, 2017 - Weird things started to happen as people showed up to vote in parts of North Carolina on Nov. 8. Why didn't state workers know that their elections contractor had been hit by a cyberattack?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 10, 2017 - Weird things started to happen as people showed up to vote in parts of North Carolina on Nov. 8. Why didn't state workers know that their elections contractor had been hit by a cyberattack? http://www.npr.org/2017/08/10/542634370/russian-cyberattack-targeted-elections-vendor-tied-to-voting-day-disruptions

item.title: Facebook Watch Is Company's New Plan For Online Video
item.description: August 10, 2017 - With nearly 2 billion users, Facebook could further disrupt an online video space — and compete with YouTube and other networks for ad revenue.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 10, 2017 - With nearly 2 billion users, Facebook could further disrupt an online video space — and compete with YouTube and other networks for ad revenue. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/10/542625208/facebook-watch-is-companys-new-plan-for-online-video

item.title: Airbnb Cancels Bookings By Users Connected To White Nationalist Rally
item.description: August 9, 2017 - NPR's Ari Shapiro talks to Deborah Hellman, a professor at the University of Virginia, about Airbnb's cancellation of bookings by attendees to a Charlottesville, Va., white nationalist event.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 9, 2017 - NPR's Ari Shapiro talks to Deborah Hellman, a professor at the University of Virginia, about Airbnb's cancellation of bookings by attendees to a Charlottesville, Va., white nationalist event. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/09/542468293/airbnb-cancels-bookings-by-users-connected-to-white-nationalist-rally

item.title: Car Seat Camouflage: Man Wears Bizarre Costume In Automatic Vehicle Experiment
item.description: August 9, 2017 - An apparently driverless van was spotted driving around Arlington, Va., recently. The vehicle appeared to have no humans on board, and the story got stranger from there.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 9, 2017 - An apparently driverless van was spotted driving around Arlington, Va., recently. The vehicle appeared to have no humans on board, and the story got stranger from there. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/09/542468251/car-seat-camouflage-man-wears-bizarre-costume-in-automatic-vehicle-experiment

item.title: Is The Memo Controversy A Pivot Point On Diversity For Google?
item.description: August 9, 2017 - Once Google is done putting out fires in the wake of a male employee's incendiary memo about gender, the company will have to think about how to tackle its longstanding diversity problem.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 9, 2017 - Once Google is done putting out fires in the wake of a male employee's incendiary memo about gender, the company will have to think about how to tackle its longstanding diversity problem. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/08/09/542412661/is-the-memo-controversy-a-pivot-point-on-diversity-for-google

item.title: Video Games May Affect The Brain Differently, Depending On What You Play
item.description: August 9, 2017 - Millions of people play video games, but there's plenty of disagreement on whether they're good or bad for brains. Action games may have a different effect than something like Super Mario.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 9, 2017 - Millions of people play video games, but there's plenty of disagreement on whether they're good or bad for brains. Action games may have a different effect than something like Super Mario. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/09/542215646/video-games-may-affect-the-brain-differently-depending-on-what-you-play

item.title: At CERN, In Search Of Nature's Building Blocks
item.description: August 9, 2017 - In a world so divided by cultural and economic warfare, what happens at the European laboratory for particle physics stands out as a celebration of the best we have to offer, says Marcelo Gleiser.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 9, 2017 - In a world so divided by cultural and economic warfare, what happens at the European laboratory for particle physics stands out as a celebration of the best we have to offer, says Marcelo Gleiser. http://www.npr.org/sections/13.7/2017/08/09/542376003/at-cern-in-search-of-nature-s-building-blocks

item.title: Disney Will End Netflix Deal And Offer Its Own Streaming Services
item.description: August 9, 2017 - There will be one streaming service for sports and another for films and television shows, the company announced on Tuesday. But new Disney movies will still be available on Netflix until 2019.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 9, 2017 - There will be one streaming service for sports and another for films and television shows, the company announced on Tuesday. But new Disney movies will still be available on Netflix until 2019. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/09/542353743/disney-will-end-netflix-deal-and-offer-its-own-streaming-services

item.title: 'Schoolifying' Minecraft Without Ruining It
item.description:
August 9, 2017 - Microsoft is trying to help more teachers use the hugely popular game in the classroom without alienating the initial enthusiasts.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/ed/2017/08/09/539518179/schoolifying-minecraft-without-ruining-it
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 9, 2017 - Microsoft is trying to help more teachers use the hugely popular game in the classroom without alienating the initial enthusiasts. http://www.npr.org/sections/ed/2017/08/09/539518179/schoolifying-minecraft-without-ruining-it

item.title: Google Memo Raises Questions About Limits Of Free Speech In The Workplace
item.description: August 8, 2017 - Google moved quickly to fire the software engineer who criticized the company's diversity programs. The engineer, James Damore, told The New York Times he has a right to express his concerns and that he will likely sue Google over the issue.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 8, 2017 - Google moved quickly to fire the software engineer who criticized the company's diversity programs. The engineer, James Damore, told The New York Times he has a right to express his concerns and that he will likely sue Google over the issue. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/08/542286029/google-memo-raises-questions-about-limits-of-free-speech-in-the-workplace

item.title: Google CEO Cuts Vacation Short To Deal With Crisis Over Diversity Memo
item.description: August 8, 2017 - CEO Sundar Pichai says that he supported the right of workers to express themselves but that a senior engineer's memo had gone too far. The memo's author says he is weighing legal action.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 8, 2017 - CEO Sundar Pichai says that he supported the right of workers to express themselves but that a senior engineer's memo had gone too far. The memo's author says he is weighing legal action. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/08/08/542210855/google-ceo-cuts-vacation-short-to-deal-with-crisis-over-diversity-memo

item.title: Google Fires Engineer Who Criticized Diversity Efforts
item.description: August 8, 2017 - The software engineer's internal memo created controversy after it was leaked. The memo, called "Google's Ideological Echo Chamber," criticized the company's efforts to diversify its workforce.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 8, 2017 - The software engineer's internal memo created controversy after it was leaked. The memo, called "Google's Ideological Echo Chamber," criticized the company's efforts to diversify its workforce. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/08/542180434/google-fires-engineer-who-criticized-diversity-efforts

item.title: The Cubist Revolution: Minecraft For All
item.description: August 8, 2017 - Minecraft, one of the most popular video games in the world, is touted for its educational possibilities. But is that potential really accessible to all?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 8, 2017 - Minecraft, one of the most popular video games in the world, is touted for its educational possibilities. But is that potential really accessible to all? http://www.npr.org/sections/ed/2017/08/08/538580856/the-cubist-revolution-minecraft-for-all
